SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Attack
An abstract class that represents an attack in the game.
Attacks are actions that can be performed by CombatEntities.
They can be used to deal damage to other CombatEntities.
This design respects modularity and scalability, as the action of the attack is its own class that encapsulates different data like
the attacker, target and all different damages/defenses and allows for complex attack mechanics in the game to coexist.
AttackElixir
Represents the Consumable Item "Attack Elixir" in the game.
The Attack Elixir can boost the attack stat of the player of 4 for the duration of a fight, it can be found or purchased in the game.
It weighs 0.2, with an in game cost of 15
BasePlayer
Class to represent the BasePlayer class in the game
It has the following fixed initial attributes:
25 health points
15 mana points
3 attack points
3 defense points
5 maximum weight capacity
10 money
It has the Focus ability
Boss
Abstract class to represent the Boss class in the game.
BossAbility
Abstract class that represents an ability that a boss can use.
BossRoom
Represents a room in the game that contains a boss.
Character
Abstract class to represent a character in the game.
A Character is a moving entity that can engage in combat with Mobs and interact with NPCs.
It is controlled by the user.
CharacterObserver
An interface that represents an observer of the game's characters.
A class extending this interface can register itself as an observer and receive notifications from the Character object
CharacterSkill
Abstract class for character skill used during combat
As with the BossAbility class, this class applies an adaptation of the Strategy pattern to the character skills, allowing for easy addition of new skills.
This class is meant to be extended by specific character skills, guaranteeing modularity.
CheatEngine
Class that represents the Cheat Engine skill, which allows the character to force the max weapon roll.
CombatEntity
An abstract class representing an entity that can either attack and be attacked
This includes the Character (the player), the Mobs and the Bosses
All combat entities have a health pool, an attack stat and a defense stat
ConsoleHandler
Utility class to handle console operations, such as:
- Set console encoding to UTF-8
- Clear console
- Escape codes for text colors
Constants
This class contains all the constants used in the game.
ASCII art, story text and music file paths are stored here.
ConsumableItem
An interface representing an item that can be consumed in the game (e.g.
Controller
Controller fa√ßade class to handle the game state and user input
It uses the Singleton pattern to ensure only one instance of the Controller class is created
It uses the Command pattern to handle the different game commands
It uses the Factory pattern to create different Characters based on the user's choice
Coordinates
Represents the coordinates used to move and initialize objects in the game map.
Coordinates.Direction
Represents the direction of movement.
CyberGoblin
Represents the CyberGoblin Mob entity in the game.
The CyberGoblin is a weak but quick enemy that can be found in the game.
CyberKatana
Represents the CyberKatana Weapon in the game.
It comes without an effect.
CyberPoison
An ability that poisons the attacker with a 45% probability, by inflicting to the player an amount of damage equals to the mob's level
It is paired with the JunkSlime.
Daburu
Class that represents the Daburu (double from japanese) skill, which forces next attack to inflict double damage.
DataThief
Class to represent the DataThief class in the game
It has the following fixed initial attributes:
20 health points
10 mana points
4 attack points
2 defense points
5 maximum weight capacity
0 money
It has the Steal ability
DefenseElixir
Represents the Consumable Item Defense Elixir in the game.
The Defense Elixir can boost the defense stat of the player of 4 for the duration of a fight, it can be found or purchased in the game.
It weighs 0.2, with an in game cost of 15
Dice
Represents a dice in the game
A dice is a random number generator with a minimum and maximum value
The dice can be rolled to get a random number between the minimum and maximum values
DiceReroller
An effect that rerolls the weapon's dice and applies the damage twice to the target
This effect has a 70% probability to apply.
It is paired with the Nano Dirk
DodgeEvenRoll
An ability that allows a boss to disable the attacker damage bonus if the attacker's weapon dice roll is an even number.
DodgeFlying
An ability that allows the mob to dodge an attack with a 25% probability.
Emp
Represents the Consumable Item EMP in the game.
The EMP allows the player to skip trap rooms, it can be found or purchased in the game.
It weighs 0.1, with an in game cost of 35
EndRoom
Represents the end room in the game.
This room marks the end of the game.
Entity
An abstract class that represents an entity in the game.
An entity is anything that can be interacted with in the game.
This includes the Character (the player), the Mobs and the Bosses
EvenBoss
Represents the EvenBoss, called Cyfartal, boss entity in the game.
The EvenBoss is the first boss of the game.
FirebaseHandler
Utility class to handle Firebase operations, such as:
- Save game to cloud
- Load game from cloud
- Delete game from cloud
Floor
Represents a floor in the game.
FlyingBoss
Represents the FlyingBoss, called Flygande, boss entity in the game.
The EvenBoss is the second boss of the game.
Focus
Class that represents the Focus skill, which adds +3 damage on next attack.
FriendlyEntity
An abstract class representing a friendly entity in the game.
Game
The Game class represents the main game logic.
It controls player movement, interactions with rooms and entities, combat, inventory management, saving and loading game data, and more.
GameIndex
A utility class for managing the index of saved games.
GameState
Represents the different states of the game
The game can be in one of these states at any given time
The state of the game determines what the player can do and what the game will do next
Glitched
Represents the Glithed Wandering Mob entity in the game.
The Glithed Wandering is a special moving entyty in the game.
GreatHealthPotion
Represents the Consumable Item Great Health Potion in the game.
The Health Potion can restore the Health Points of the player by 50, it can be found or purchased in the game.
It weighs 0.3, with an in game cost of 18
GreatManaPotion
Represents the Consumable Item Great Mana Potion in the game.
The Great Mana Potion can restore the Mana of the player by 30, it can be found or purchased in the game.
It weighs 0.3, with an in game cost of 18
Guard
Class that represents the Guard skill, which halfs the opponent next attack.
Hacker
Class to represent the Hacker class in the game
It has the following fixed initial attributes:
18 health points
20 mana points
3 attack points
3 defense points
5 maximum weight capacity
10 money
It has the CheatEngine ability
HalveDamage
An ability that allows a boss to halven the player's weapon roll.
HalverBoss
Represents the HalverBoss, called Leth, Boss entity in the game.
The EvenBoss is the second boss of the game.
HealingRoom
Class that represents a healing room in the game.
It is situated between each floor and allows the player to heal completely and meet some FriendlyEntity.
You can also buy items from Merchant or upgrade your weapon from a Smith
HealthAbsorber
An effect that absorbs health from the target and heals the character holding the weapon
This effect is has a 66,6% chance to apply but it doesn't consume mana
It is paired with the Nanite Leech Blade
HealthPotion
Represents the Consumable Item Health Potion in the game.
The Health Potion can restore the Health Points of the player by 20, it can be found or purchased in the game.
It weighs 0.2, with an in game cost of 10
HostileRoom
Class that represents a hostile room in the game
Contains the mobs of the room
Inherits from the Room class.
InflictDamage
Class that implements a room effect that inflicts damage to the character
Inflicts 10 damage to the player if it rolls < 5 on D6
Inventory
Represents the inventory of an entity in the game.
Item
An abstract class representing an item in the game
All items have a weight, and can be picked up by the player
Some items can be purchased, and some can be consumed to provide benefits to the player
ItemReceiverEntity
An interface representing an entity that can receive items in the game
This interface is meant to be implemented by entities that can receive items as Smith
ItemsHolderEntity
Interface to represent an entity that can hold items in its inventory.
JetBat
Represents the JetBat Mob entity in the game.
The JetBat is a flying enemy that can be found in the game.
It has 7 health points
3 attack points
1 defense points
5 dice faces
4 experience points drop
2 money drop.
It has the DodgeFlying ability
JsonParser
This class is a utility class for parsing JSON files.
JunkSlime
Represents the JunkSlime Mob entity in the game.
The JunkSlime is a resilient enemy that can be found in the game.
LaserBlade
Represents the LaserBlade Weapon in the game.
It comes without an effect.
LootRoom
Class that represents a loot room in the game.
Main
Entry point of the program.
ManaAttackBooster
An effect that allows the weapon to inflict from 5 to 10 dmg points
It requires 3 mana points to be used
It is paired with the Pulse Staff
ManaPotion
Represents the Consumable Item Mana Potion in the game.
The Mana Potion can restore the Mana of the player by 10, it can be found or purchased in the game.
It weighs 0.2, with an in game cost of 10
MechaKnight
Class to represent the MechaKnight class in the game
It has the following fixed initial attributes:
30 health points
5 mana points
1 attack points
5 defense points
5 maximum weight capacity
15 money
It has the Guard ability
MechaRat
Represents the MechaRat Mob entity in the game.
The MechaRat is a small enemy that can be found in the game.
Merchant
Represents a merchant NPC in the game.
Mob
Represents a mob in the game.
MobAbility
Abstract class representing an ability that a mob can use during combat.
MobAttack
Represents an Attack performed by a mob.
MovingEntity
Represents an entity that can move in the game.
MusicPlayer
Class that represents a music player in the game
Used to play music files in the game
NaniteLeechBlade
Represents the NaniteLeechBlade Weapon in the game.
It is paired with the HealthAbsorber ability
It weighs 0.8 and is equipped with a D12
NanoDirk
Represents the NanoDirk Weapon in the game.
It is paired with the DiceReroller ability, that allows its holder to roll twice its dice per attack
It weighs 0.5 and is equipped with a D6
NeoSamurai
Class to represent the NeoSamurai class in the game
It has the following fixed initial attributes:
20 health points
10 mana points
5 attack points
1 defense points
5 maximum weight capacity
15 money
It has the Daburu ability
NetworkUtils
Utility class to handle network operations, such as:
- Check if internet is available
NibbleItem
An ability that allows the mob to destroy a random item from the player's inventory once per fight with a 20% probability
It is paired with the MechaRat.
NorthStar
Represents the Consumable Item NorthStar in the game.
The NorthStar can print the entire game map, it can be found as a special reward.
It weighs 0.0
PlasmaGreatsword
Represents the PlasmaGreatsword Weapon in the game.
It comes without an effect.
PlayerAttack
Represents an Attack performed by the player.
PlayerRoomVisitor
PlayerRoomVisitor class to handle the visit different types of rooms in the game.
PulseStaff
Represents the PulseStaff Weapon in the game.
The PulseStaff is an rare heavy weapon with a long blade that can be found in the game.
PurchasableItem
An abstract class representing an item that can be purchased in the game via Merchant
This class is meant to be extended by specific purchasable items, guaranteeing modularity
Ragu
Represents the Consumable Item Ragu in the game.
Item Ragu restore all HP and Mana, boosts def stat and the damage inflicted by a 2 factor for the duration of a fight, it can be found or purchased in the game.
It weighs 1.0, with an in game cost of 0
Room
Abstract class that represents a room in the game
RoomEffect
Interface for room effects
This interface is meant to be implemented by classes that represent effects that can be applied to a character when they enter a room, guaranteeing modularity.
RoomType
Enum that represents the different types of rooms in the game
Smith
Represents a Smith NPC in the game.
SpecialKey
Represents the Consumable Item Special Key in the game.
The Special Key opens a special locked loot room, it can be found or purchased in the game.
It weighs 0.0, with an in game cost of D
StartRoom
Represents the starting room in the game.
This room is always visited since the game starts here.
Steal
Class that represents the Steal skill, which allows the character to steal a random item and add it to the inventory with a 40% probability.
StealItem
An ability that allows the mob to steal from 3 to 6 BTCs once per fight with a 25% probability
It is paired with the CyberGoblin.
StealMoney
Class that implements a room effect that steals money from the character
Steals 10 money from the player if it doesn't roll 6 on D6
Teleport
Class that implements a room effect that teleports the character to a random room
Teleports the player to a random room in the same floor causing the player to forget the visited rooms(doesn't apply with NorthStar item)
TrapRoom
Represents a trap room in the game.
VampireDodge
An ability that allows a boss to dodge player's attack and heal itself of player's weapon roll with a 33% probability.
Weapon
An abstract class that represents a weapon that can be used to attack enemies
Different weapons have different effects that are applied to the target when they are hit
They are also equipped with a Dice that is rolled to determine the damage dealt to the target (in addition to the player's base damage stat).
WeaponEffect
An abstract class representing an effect that can be applied to a weapon
As with the MobAbility class, this class applies an adaptation of the Strategy pattern to the weapon effects, allowing for easy addition of new effects
This class is meant to be extended by specific weapon effects, guaranteeing modularity
WeaponShard
Represents the Consumable Item Weapon Shard in the game.
The Weapon Shard upgrades the current weapon of the player if given to a smith, it can be found or purchased in the game.
It weighs 0.5, with an in game cost of 40
